lead_paragraph: Two American servicemen were killed and a third injured in separate incidents today, a deadly reminder of the dangers facing both occupation forces and ordinary Iraqis in a country where the only surplus commodities are weapons. A sniper killed one of the Americans in east Baghdad, according to the Pentagon. The second, a member of the Army's V Corps, was shot and killed while directing traffic on a bridge.

headline.main: 2 More Servicemen Killed In New Attacks in Baghdad

abstract: Two American servicemen are killed and third injured in separate incidents in Baghdad, in deadly reminder of dangers facing both occupation forces and ordinary Iraqis in country with surplus of weapons; sniper killed one American in east Baghdad, and second was shot and killed while directing traffic on bridge; third was injured when his Humvee ran over land mine that had been buried night before; Army still has only skeleton crew of lightly armed local law enforcement officers to help maintain order in sprawling city of five million people (M)
